CBP¶

Collimated Beam Projector

cbp is for measuring light produced by a laser based source.

Code author: Michael Coughlin, Eric Coughlin

Altaz¶

Code author: Michael Coughlin, Eric Coughlin

class cbp.altaz.Altaz[source]¶

This class is for controlling the motors of the device which move horizontally and vertically.

do_altangle()[source]¶
Parameters:
  • val – The angle to move by.
  • motornum – the motor to move by. 1 is left to right, 2 is up to down.
Returns:
do_azangle()[source]¶
Parameters:
  • val – The angle to move by
  • motornum – The axis to move on by motor.
Returns:
do_compile()[source]¶

Compiles the device

Returns:
do_steps(motornum, val)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • motornum – the motor number to move the device.
  • val –
Returns:
receive()[source]¶

return 6 bytes from the receive buffer there must be 6 bytes to receive (no error checking)

Returns:
send(device, command, data=0)[source]¶

send a packet using the specified device number, command number, and data The data argument is optional and defaults to zero

Parameters:
  • device –
  • command –
  • data –
Returns:

Parameters:
  • mag –
  • direction –
  • motornum –
Returns:

Parse the options given on the command-line.

Code author: Michael Coughlin, Eric Coughlin

This is a class for communicating with the Birger instrument.

Parameters:val – This is the value of the aperture
Returns:
do_focus(val)[source]¶
Parameters:val – This is the value that the focus will be set to.
Returns:sets the focus of the birger.

Returns:This returns the focus and aperture of the birger.

Returns:returns the open serial port otherwise exits the program with a error code.

receives a message from the birger port

Returns:returns the message from the port

Parameters:command – This is the command to send to the birger
Returns:

CBP Instrument¶

Code author: Michael Coughlin, Eric Coughlin

class cbp.cbp_instrument.CBP(altaz=False, birger=False, filter_wheel=False, keithley=False, lamp=False, monochromater=False, phidget=False, photodiode=False, potentiometer=False, shutter=False, spectrograph=False, lockin=False, temperature=False, laser=False, everything=False)[source]¶

This is the class that contains all of the written cbp instrument modules.

check_status()[source]¶

This methods calls the check status of each instrument.

Returns:
get_spectograph_average(output_dir='/home/pi/CBP/keithley/', n_averages=3, duration=1000000, dark=False)[source]¶

This method calculates the spectrograph average and writes out the results to files.

Parameters:
  • output_dir – This is the output directory of where the spectrograph file goes.
  • n_averages – This is the number of averages for the spectrograph
  • duration – This is the amount of time in microseconds that the spectrograph will measure light
  • dark – This is a flag that specifies whether the light source is on or off.
Returns:
keithley_change_wavelength_loop(output_dir='data', wavelength_min=500, wavelength_max=700, wavelength_steps=10, n_averages=3, duration=1000000)[source]¶

Takes an average from reading photodiode and spectograph with both opening and closing the shutter.

Parameters:
  • output_dir – This is the root directory where files are written
  • wavelength_min – This is the starting wavelength
  • wavelength_max – This is the ending wavelength
  • wavelength_steps – This is the number of steps that are taken at each wavelength change.
  • n_averages – This is the number of times that the photodiodes are read which is used to calculate an average.
  • duration – This is the length of time that the spectrograph will sleep for per reading.
Returns:

Ostensibly doesn’t return anything, but writes out data files that show average photodiode and spectograph readings at each wavelength.
load_status_log_xml(status_log_file)[source]¶

This is a method to load the status log xml file

Parameters:status_log_file – This is location of the status log file to load.
Returns:
write_status_log(output_dir='/home/pi/CBP/status_logs/', duration=1000000)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • output_dir – This is where the status log will be written to.
  • duration – This is the length of the measuring of the light by the spectropgraph.
Returns:
write_status_log_xml(output_dir='/home/pi/CBP/status_log_xml/', duration=1000000)[source]¶

This method writes out the status log file but in xml format.

Parameters:
  • output_dir – This is where the status log will be written to.
  • duration – This is the length of the measuring of the light by the spectropgraph.
Returns:

Filter Wheel¶

Code author: Michael Coughlin, Eric Coughlin

class cbp.filter_wheel.FilterWheel[source]¶

This is the class for communicating with the Filter Wheel.

check_status()[source]¶
Returns:changes the status of the Filter Wheel depending on location of device in kernel.
do_position(mask, filter)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • mask – This is the value of the mask
  • filter – This is the value of the filter.
Returns:

sets the position of the Filter Wheel.
error_raised()[source]¶
Returns:either raises an exception if parameters out of bounds or returns false to continue the program
get_position()[source]¶
Returns:returns the current mask and filter values of the Filter Wheel.
initialize_connection()[source]¶
Returns:returns the connection to the Filter Wheel.
cbp.filter_wheel.parse_commandline()[source]¶

Parse the options given on the command-line.

Laser¶

Code author: Eric Coughlin

This is a module that communicates with the ESKPLA laser in the lab via RS232 port.

class cbp.laser.LaserSerialInterface(loop=True)[source]¶

This class is for communicating with the laser through the RS232 serial interface.

change_wavelength(wavelength)[source]¶

This method changes the wavelength of the laser.

Parameters:wavelength – This is the value of the wavelength to be set. Units are in nanometers and limits are 355nm to 2300 nm.
Returns:
check_state()[source]¶

This method checks the status of the laser and then sets the state of the laser inside of the class.

Returns:
check_wavelength(comparison=False)[source]¶
Parameters:comparison – This is a flag as to whether wavelength values will be compared or not.
Returns:
get_ready_state()[source]¶

This method calls the check_state() until a ready state is set by the class.

Returns:
loop_change_wavelength(min, max, diagnostic)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • min – The starting wavelength
  • max – the ending wavelength
  • diagnostic – whether this loop is going to wait for user input to continue
Returns:
parse_wavelength(msg='[MS:W0/S520\\NL]')[source]¶
Parameters:msg – This is the message to parse.
Returns:
test_state()[source]¶

This is a method for testing the state of the laser in a loop-back environment.

Returns:
cbp.laser.main(wavelength)[source]¶

This creates a command line and arguments for the script.

Returns:None

Lockin¶

Code author: Michael Coughlin, Eric Coughlin

Warning

This module is currently inactive

class cbp.lockin.LockIn(rm=None, resnum=None)[source]¶

This is a class for communicating with the lockin instrument

initialize()[source]¶

This method initializes the lockin :return:

query_R_theta()[source]¶

query the radius and phase of signal at the exact same instant

query_XY()[source]¶

query the X and Y of signal at the exact same instant

query_ch1_ch2(x, y)[source]¶

query the ch1 and ch2 of signal at the same instant

query_f_R_theta()[source]¶

query the frequency, radius and phase of signal

query_frequency()[source]¶

query the reference frequency

query_ref_mode()[source]¶

returns 1 (internal) or 0 (external)

query_unit_Id()[source]¶

This method returns the unit id :return:

set_frequency(f)[source]¶

set the reference frequency

set_harmonic(i=1)[source]¶

set the i-th harmonic to measure

set_ref_mode(i)[source]¶

set the reference source. The parameter i selects internal (i=1) or external (i=0)

cbp.lockin.parse_commandline()[source]¶

Parse the options given on the command-line.

Shutter¶

Code author: Michael Coughlin, Eric Coughlin

class cbp.shutter.Shutter[source]¶

This is the class for communicating with the shutter

check_status()[source]¶

This method checks the status of the shutter

Returns:
close_connection()[source]¶

This method closes the shutter

Returns:
create_connection()[source]¶

This method creates a connection by using a child process.

Returns:
do_compile()[source]¶

This method compiles the shutter arduino code.

Returns:
run_shutter(shutter)[source]¶

This method is a duration run of the shutter, -1 can be used to keep shutter open indefinitely or 0 to close it.

Parameters:shutter – This is the length that the shutter will stay open in milliseconds.
Returns:
cbp.shutter.parse_commandline()[source]¶

Parse the options given on the command-line.
